introduction: Men in the UK are working fewer hours, while women are working more. Since the pandemic the average

vocabulary.example: The rope was slack, hanging loosely from the mast.

vocabulary.definition: to do work that someone else hasn't done
vocabulary.example: During the project, Sarah had to pick up the slack when her colleague fell ill.

vocabulary.definition: to cause a pattern of behavior to happen
vocabulary.example: New technology innovations often drive a trend towards increased automation.

vocabulary.definition: to spend time or effort on something
vocabulary.example: She put in extra hours to meet the deadline for the project.

vocabulary.definition: committing money or resources to achieve a profit or result
vocabulary.example: Many people are investing in renewable energy for a more sustainable future.

vocabulary.definition: able to be easily modified to respond to altered circumstances or conditions
vocabulary.example: Having a flexible schedule allows employees to balance work and personal commitments effectively.
